workflow.name: AI automate UX feedback: Sentiment & emotion analysis in Google Sheets + OpenAI
workflow.description:
## Who's it for
[![Auto-Tag & Analyze Customer Feedback ‚Äî n8n + OpenAI](https://img.youtube.com/vi/tbx5rTQqIKs/hqdefault.jpg)](https://youtu.be/tbx5rTQqIKs)

**Product managers**, **customer success teams**, and **UX researchers** who collect feedback in Google Sheets and want to automatically **categorize** and analyze it with **sentiment and emotions** insights. Ideal for teams processing dozens or hundreds of customer comments daily.

- [Read on Medium](https://medium.com/@parhumm/the-future-of-listening-how-ai-turns-feedback-into-clarity-free-ux-n8n-ai-workflow-5dea288ecde1)
- [Watch on Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=tbx5rTQqIKs&feature=youtu.be)

## What it does

This workflow automatically tags and analyzes customer feedback stored in **Google Sheets** using OpenAI's GPT-4. It reads unprocessed feedback entries, sends them in batches to **OpenAI** for intelligent tagging and sentiment analysis, then writes the results back to your sheet‚Äîcomplete with up to **3 relevant tags per feedback, sentiment scores (Very Negative to Very Positive), and emotional analysis.**

The workflow uses batch processing to **optimize API costs:** instead of sending 10 separate requests, it sends one request with all 10 feedbacks, reducing API calls by ~90%.

## How it works
1. Fetches allowed tags from a Tags sheet and new feedback entries (where Status is empty) from a Feedbacks sheet
2. Merges tags with feedbacks and processes them in batches of 10
3. Sends each batch to OpenAI with a structured prompt requesting tags, sentiment, and emotional analysis
4. Writes results back to Google Sheets with tags, sentiment, emotions, and timestamps

## Requirements

- Google Sheets account with OAuth2 credentials
- OpenAI API account (uses GPT-4o-mini model)
- Google Sheet template with two sheets: "Tags" (single column) and "Feedbacks" (with columns: Feedbacks, Status, Tag 1-3, Sentiment, Primary/Secondary Emotion, AI Tag 1-2, Updated Date)

## Setup instructions

1. Duplicate the provided [Google Sheet template](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1y7B3u5vgQLDidf-NdfPgAiBuQxP9Qa7RvdgsTPG14Fs/edit?gid=0#gid=0)
2. **Connect your credentials** in n8n:
   - Google Sheets OAuth2 API
   - OpenAI API
3. **Update Sheet URLs** in these nodes:
   - "Fetch Allowed Tags" - point to your Tags sheet
   - "Fetch New Feedbacks" - point to your Feedbacks sheet  
   - "Update Google Sheet (Tagged)" - point to your Feedbacks sheet
4. **Test manually** first using the Manual Trigger, then enable the Schedule Trigger for automatic processing every 60 minutes

## How to customize

- **Adjust batch size**: Change the batch size in "Process Feedbacks in Batches" (default: 10) to process more or fewer feedbacks per API call
- **Modify tagging logic**: Edit the system prompt in "Tag Feedbacks with AI" to change how tags are selected or add custom sentiment categories
- **Change schedule**: Update the Schedule Trigger interval (default: 60 minutes) based on your feedback volume
- **Extend the workflow**: Add nodes to send results to Slack, Notion, or Airtable for real-time alerts on negative feedback

workflow.name: Auto-tag and analyze customer feedback in Google Sheets with OpenAI

values.content:
=You are a tagging, sentiment, and emotion analysis assistant.  

Input format:
- You will receive multiple feedbacks in an array under `feedbacks`.
- Each feedback item has: `row_number` and `text`.
- Feedback text may be multilingual (e.g., Persian/Farsi). Analyze natively.
- You will also receive an `allowed_tags` array (may be empty).

General rules:
- Analyze each feedback independently.
- Detect and describe emotional tone naturally.
- Identify one **primary emotion** that captures the dominant feeling.
- Optionally include up to two **secondary emotions** that reflect additional nuances.
- Output must be a **valid JSON array** only, with **no extra text** before or after.
- Maintain the original input order.

‚ö†Ô∏è CRITICAL TAGGING RULES (2-tier system with STRONG preference for allowed_tags):

**TIER 1: ALWAYS TRY ALLOWED TAGS FIRST (Your Primary Responsibility)**
- If `allowed_tags` is provided, you MUST thoroughly examine it for matches.
- **Be creative and flexible in matching:**
  - Look for direct matches (e.g., "Bug" for bug reports)
  - Look for semantic matches (e.g., "Payment" tag for "billing issue" feedback)
  - Look for category matches (e.g., "Performance" for "slow", "lag", "loading")
  - Look for broader themes (e.g., "User Experience" for usability complaints)
- **Think broadly:** A tag doesn't need to be a perfect word-for-word match.
- Consider the **intent and topic** of the feedback, not just exact keywords.
- Return up to **3** most relevant tags from `allowed_tags` (sorted by relevance).
- **Only proceed to Tier 2 if you genuinely cannot find ANY relevant match** after careful analysis.

**TIER 2: AI-Generated Tags (ONLY as a last resort)**
- Use this ONLY when:
  - `allowed_tags` is completely empty, OR
  - After thorough analysis, absolutely NO tag in `allowed_tags` relates to the feedback topic
- Generate up to **2 custom, descriptive tags** (short labels like "UI Bug", "Pricing Question").
- Put these in `ai_tag_1` and `ai_tag_2`.
- Use "" for empty AI tag fields.

**Decision Flow:**
1. Read the feedback carefully
2. Review ALL allowed_tags thoroughly
3. Can you match any tag semantically or thematically? ‚Üí YES = Use allowed tags, set ai_tag_1="", ai_tag_2=""
4. Still no match after careful review? ‚Üí Use AI tags as fallback

Sentiment scale (choose one):
["Very Negative", "Negative", "Neutral", "Positive", "Very Positive"].

Emotions:
- primary_emotion: one clear emotional label (e.g., "anger", "hope", "disappointment", "relief", "satisfaction", "gratitude").
- secondary_emotion: optional supporting emotional state (e.g., "frustration", "trust", "curiosity", "anxiety"). Use "" if none applies.

Response JSON schema (use exactly these keys):
[
  {
    "row_number": <row_number from input>,
    "tags": ["tag_from_allowed_list_1", "tag_from_allowed_list_2"],
    "ai_tag_1": "",
    "ai_tag_2": "",
    "sentiment": "Positive",
    "primary_emotion": "Gratitude",
    "secondary_emotion": "Relief"
  }
]

Examples of GOOD matching behavior:
‚úÖ Feedback: "The app crashes constantly" + allowed_tags: ["Bug", "Stability", "Feature"] ‚Üí tags: ["Bug", "Stability"]
‚úÖ Feedback: "Can't complete checkout" + allowed_tags: ["Payment", "Technical Issue", "UI"] ‚Üí tags: ["Payment", "Technical Issue"]
‚úÖ Feedback: "Love the new design!" + allowed_tags: ["Design", "Positive Feedback", "UI"] ‚Üí tags: ["Design", "Positive Feedback"]
‚úÖ Feedback: "Too expensive for what it offers" + allowed_tags: ["Pricing", "Value", "Feature Request"] ‚Üí tags: ["Pricing", "Value"]

Examples of when to use AI tags:
‚ùå Feedback: "Bug in login" + allowed_tags: [] ‚Üí tags: [], ai_tag_1: "Authentication Bug", ai_tag_2: "Login"
‚ùå Feedback: "Need dark mode" + allowed_tags: ["Pricing", "Support", "Payment"] ‚Üí tags: [], ai_tag_1: "Feature Request", ai_tag_2: "UI Customization"

Constraints:
- **STRONGLY PREFER allowed_tags** - exhaust all matching possibilities first
- Do **not** invent tags in the `tags` array ‚Äî only use exact names from `allowed_tags`
- Generate creative tags for `ai_tag_1` and `ai_tag_2` ONLY when truly necessary
- Use ASCII keys exactly as shown. Values must be strings or arrays of strings
- Do not include reasoning, markdown, or comments ‚Äî **JSON array only**

parameters.content:
## üí¨ **Auto-tag customer feedback in Google Sheets with OpenAI sentiment analysis**

This workflow automatically tags user feedback stored in Google Sheets using OpenAI with sentiment and emotion analysis.  
It reads new feedback, analyzes them in **batches** with a single AI call, and returns relevant tags with detailed insights.

---

### üß† What It Does
- Fetches **allowed tags** from a Tags Sheet  
- Reads **new feedback** (Status = empty) from a Feedbacks Sheet  
- **Sends entire batches (e.g., 10 items) to OpenAI as a single request** üöÄ
- Returns up to **3 most relevant tags** from allowed list (or AI-generated tags as fallback)
- Analyzes **sentiment** (Very Negative to Very Positive)
- Detects **emotions** (primary & secondary feelings)
- Writes all results back to Google Sheets (tags, sentiment, emotions, status, timestamp)

---

### üöÄ How to Set Up  
1. Duplicate the provided [Google Sheet template](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1y7B3u5vgQLDidf-NdfPgAiBuQxP9Qa7RvdgsTPG14Fs/edit?usp=sharing).
2. Connect your **Google Sheets** and **OpenAI** credentials in n8n.  
3. Update the Sheet URLs in the **Fetch Allowed Tags**, **Fetch New Feedbacks**, and **Update Google Sheet** nodes.  
4. Run manually with the **Manual Trigger** or enable the **Schedule Trigger** (runs every 60 minutes).  

---

### üé® How to Customize  
- Adjust the **System Prompt** in the "Tag Feedbacks with AI" node to change tagging rules.  
- Edit the **batch size** (default: 10) in the "Process Feedbacks in Batches" node for performance optimization.  
- Change the **schedule interval** in the "Schedule Trigger" node (default: 60 minutes).  
- Extend the workflow to send results to Notion, Slack, or Airtable for real-time reporting.

---

#### üí° Example Use Case
Ideal for product and research teams who collect customer feedback and want to categorize it automatically into clear, actionable topics with sentiment and emotional insights.

### üè∑Ô∏è **Fetch Allowed Tags**

Reads the list of available tag names from your **Tags Sheet**.  
Each tag is stored in an array and later passed to OpenAI as `allowed_tags`.

‚úÖ Make sure your Tags sheet has a single column named `Tags`.

## üí¨ **Fetch New Feedbacks**

Reads feedback entries from **Feedbacks Sheet** where `Status` is empty.

### Expected Columns
- **Feedbacks:** The feedback text
- **Status:** Empty = new | "Updated" = tagged | "Needs Review" = no tags found
- **Tag 1, Tag 2, Tag 3:** Up to 3 tags from allowed list
- **AI Tag 1, AI Tag 2:** Fallback tags when no allowed tags match
- **Sentiment:** Very Negative to Very Positive
- **Primary Emotion:** Dominant feeling (e.g., frustration, gratitude)
- **Secondary Emotion:** Optional secondary feeling
- **Updated Date (N8N):** Processing timestamp

‚úÖ All columns must exist with exact names.

## ü§ñ **Tag Feedbacks with OpenAI**

Sends entire batch (10 items) as ONE OpenAI request. üöÄ

**Output per feedback:**
- Up to 3 tags from allowed_tags (preferred)
- Up to 2 AI-generated tags (fallback only)
- Sentiment: Very Negative to Very Positive
- Primary & secondary emotions
- Multilingual support (including Persian/Farsi)

‚úÖ Returns valid JSON array.

## üìä **Update Google Sheet (Tagged)**

Updates **Feedbacks Sheet** with:
- `Tag 1-3` (from allowed list)
- `AI Tag 1-2` (fallback tags)
- `Sentiment`
- `Primary Emotion` & `Secondary Emotion`
- `Status` ("Updated" or "Needs Review")
- `Updated Date (N8N)`

‚úÖ Ensure columns exist with exact names.

## üîÅ **Split In Batches**

Breaks large feedback lists into smaller batches to avoid API rate limits.  
After each batch is processed, the loop continues automatically until all rows are tagged.

üí° Default batch size = 10 (you can adjust in config sheet).

## üîó **Merge Tags & Feedbacks**

This node combines two input streams:
- **Input 1:** Feedback items fetched from the Feedbacks Sheet  
- **Input 2:** Allowed tag list fetched from the Tags Sheet  

Mode: `Choose Branch`  
Output: Keeps Feedback data (Input 1) while waiting for Tags (Input 2) to arrive.  
Ensures each feedback item can access the full tag list before analysis.

## üß© **Attach Tags Array**

Adds the list of tags from the Tags Sheet to each feedback item.  
The result includes a field named `tags`, used by OpenAI for tagging.

## üñ±Ô∏è **Manual Trigger**

Runs the workflow manually when you click **"Execute Workflow"** inside n8n.  
Use this for quick testing or when setting up new credentials and connections.

üí° Best for testing small batches before enabling the automatic schedule.

## ‚è∞ **Schedule Trigger**

Runs every **60 minutes** automatically.

Processes all feedback where Status = empty/blank.

## üì¶ **Aggregate Batch Items**

**Collects all feedback items in the current batch and combines them into a single item.**

This allows us to send all 10 feedbacks (or configured batch size) as ONE request to OpenAI instead of 10 separate requests.

üí∞ **Cost savings:** ~90% reduction in API calls!

## üîÄ **Split Batch Results**

**Parses the OpenAI response and splits it back into individual feedback items.**

Each item contains:
- `row_number`: To match with the original Google Sheet row
- `tags`: Array of tag names (up to 3)
- `sentiment`: Sentiment classification

These items are then sent to the Google Sheet update node one by one.
